page.title: 09 FARMING
page.content: The area around Kingswear is nearly all farmland.The majority of the land is privately owned but aboat quarter owned by the National Trust and leased to tenants.In our D block there are four Farms. The main type of farming carried out in this area is mixed farming.This means that farmers rear cattle for meat and milk and sheep for meat and wool. They also grow wheat and barley together with hay, silage and straw.Very few root crops or other vegetables are grown. I live on Croftland Farm.It has 122 acres. There are 50 sheep for wool and 75 for meat and 20 breeding.We have a herd of 90 cows,half for breeding and half for milk. { John Haris,Matthew Parkes
